result.execSummary:
The defendant Lisa Jane Kovach was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Lisa Jane Kovach is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Lisa Jane Kovach was found guilty of Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).
  • Lisa Jane Kovach was found guilty of Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).
  • Lisa Jane Kovach was found guilty of Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.

The defendant may not enter into any bars or taverns.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

#1 - lab results; #2 - JOC from 07TR464

Defendant Lisa Jane Kovach in court with attorney Daniel Terry Cveykus.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 11:44 AM. State - resolved . Court - amends counts #2 and #3 as stated on paperwork contrary to 961.41(3g)(d) - both counts - filed by Cveykus and dismisses count #4. Cveykus pleads NC to count #1 as alleged and to amended counts #2 and #3. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her constitutional rights by entering her plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State offers exhibits #1 and #2 - makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation as stated on paperwork prepared by Cveykus. Cveykus makes final argument prior to sentencing - asks for time to report on 3/24/15 for stated reasons - asks for exclusion of IID on two vehicles as listed on form. Kovach makes statement. Court receives exibits #1 and #2 after no objection - sentences the defendant to the following: count #1 - 5 days in FC jail - huber allowed - credit for 1 day (stipulated) - report by 8:00 AM on or before 3/24/15, $1379.00 fine - take bond posted - remainder due thru probation on counts #2 and #3, 12 month DL revocation, IID - 12 months - on DL and any vehicles titled in her name commencing upon issuance of valid DL, AODA; counts #2 and #3 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 years, concurrent to each other, with conditions of: AODA and follow thru, maintain absolute sobriety and no entry into any bars or taverns, reimburse FOSO for cost of blood draw ($35.00), 200 hours of community service, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, costs on each count - paid thru probation with DNA surcharge on one count - DNA, signs IID exemption, right to appeal, adjourned.
Final pre-trial on February 17, 2015 at 11:30 am.

Called at 9:45 AM. Lisa Kovach appears in person and with counsel Dan Cveykus. State by JBC. State - not resolved yet - asks for another FPT date. Court continues bond, set for another FPT on 2/17/15 at 11:30 AM.
Final pre-trial on December 17, 2014 at 09:30 am.

Called at 2:12 PM. Lisa Kovach appears in person and with counsel Daniel Cveykus. State appears by Jodie Bednar-Clemens. Judge O'melia appears telephonic from Oneida County. Cveykus - not resolved - just got blood results this week and ned to go over that information with his client. Court continues bond, set for FPT on 12/17/14 at 9:30 AM (this is backing up a JT for Judge O'Melia).
Pre-trial conference on November 13, 2014 at 02:15 pm.

Called at 1:11 AM. Lisa Kovach appears in person and with counsel Daniel Cveykus. State appears by Charles Simono. Cveykus has Information, waives reading, enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts pleas, continues bond, set for PTC on 11/13/14 at 2:15 PM, telephonic if not resolved. Cveykus - blood tests not back yet.
Arraignment on October 6, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Called at 9:53 AM. Lisa Kovach appears in person and with counsel Daniel Cveykus. State by Jodi Bednar Clemens. Cveykus has complaint, waives reading, waives time limits for PH. Court continues bond, set for PH on 9/25/14 at 2:00 PM.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 20, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Called at 9:45 AM. Lisa Kovach appears in person and without counsel. State appears by JBC. Kovach does not have complaint. State provides defendant with complaint in court. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Kovach understands charges and penalties, wants an attorney, believes she can hire her own. Court provides with forms for court appointed attorney. Court continues bond, set for AIA on 8/20/14 at 9:00 AM, do not appear without an attorney.
